word: But I cannot write more now. I will try to write again soon. I could not sleep after one o'clock this morning. I have had many things to think of. Today Willie and Dr. [A. J.] Sanderson go to San Francisco to attend a meeting of the Medical Board, where some important matters will be settled, we hope, after the mind of Christ.--Letter 125, Sept. 1, 1901, to Elder and Mrs. S.N. Haskell, who were doing evangelistic work among the blacks of New York City.
